intro: Sticherus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sticherus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Sticherus pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
